title: If El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie Left You Disappointed, You Probably Missed Out On These 10 Details
text:
El Camino was dripping in nostalgia and yet some people didn’t notice!

It was six years ago that Breaking Bad ended with a bloody and most satisfying ending ever – killing its most favourite character Walter White, the chemistry school teacher who turned into drug lord. But what about El Camino: A Breaking Bad movie, was it as satisfying as the show?

A lot of people said that El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie was like the post-credit scene that we all probably didn’t need. Did we really need to watch a 2 hour movie to know how Jesse Pinkman ran off? Most fans are disappointed.

via GIPHY

But it has been six years since the epic cult show, which is also holds a Guinness World Records as the highest-rated TV series ever, was released. Six years later, you might have forgotten the little details that were showed in El Camino: A Breaking Bad movie.

These little details that you might have missed answered a lot of questions. For die hard fans, the film was full of references from the show.

via GIPHY

#1 Do you remember Jesse always wanted to go to Alaska? Now, we finally know why!

In season five, when Saul Goodman is trying to sell him the idea of getting a new identity and asks him as to where he would want to go, Jesse’s answer is Alaska.

Netflix

Don't Miss 23.2 K SHARES 4.6 K SHARES 1.9 K SHARES 3.2 K SHARES 3.1 K SHARES

In El Camino, Mike tells him, in the flashback scene, that he wants to start over again in Alaska if he could. So, it was originally Mike’s idea. Jesse just followed his plan. If you remember, it is after this scene that Walter had shot Mike.

#2 Jesse said his iconic line! ‘Yeah, bitch! Magnets’

Remember when Jesse on the show excitedly screamed, “Yeah, bitch! Magnets.” If you don’t, here’s a flashback.

He did that again in El Camino, when the junkyard owner is surveying his car. For old times sake, he says, “Magnets”,” recalling that scene. He adds, “Yeah, that was a good one.”

Netflix

#3 That Beetle had a reference!

In one of the episodes of Breaking Bad, Jesse is admiring a beetle crawling on the ground just moments before Skinny Pete stomps on it for no reason. In El Camino, Jesse is once again shown admiring a similar beetle, whose fate is much sunnier. This proved that Jesse Pinkman is no killer. Also, bugs are very important on the show.

#4 The tarantula also had a connection with Breaking Bad.

Netflix

The tarantula that we saw in El Camino was the same on that the kid Drew Sharp had. Drew was the boy who was murdered because he was at the wrong place at the wrong time.

In season five, remember when Jesse stole a thousand gallons of methylamine from a moving train with the help of Walt, Todd, and Mike? No one saw him but the young boy, who was shot at by Todd later.

Netflix

In El Camino, we saw that Todd kept the tarantula in a glass tank. That’s the reason why the movie kept focussing on the Todd’s pet tarantula.

#5 Los Pollos Hermanos was replaced by Twisters

Remember Los Pollos Hermanos, which was basically Gus Fring’s cover-up operation? That in the movie was replaced with Twisters.

Netflix

Fun Fact: In the real world as well, the Los Pollos Hermanos location has long been a Twisters. In fact, in 2013, it was reported that fans would often go to Twisters and ask about Gus Fring.

#6 Saul Goodman’s office was replaced with a sports bar!

Netflix

The place where Saul Goodman’s office used to be, it was replaced by a restaurant Duke City Sports Bar. This is shown on the news on TV.

#7 Police connected Lydia’s death with that of Walter White.

Netflix

Remember when Jesse was listening to the radio in the car, police is talking about a woman who was poisoned in Houston. Her death was being connected to that of Walter White. The woman was Lydia Rodarte-Quayle.

In the show, the last we saw her was when Walt calls her to inform that he had swapped out her Stevia for ricin, a deadly poison. So, now we know she died at her home.

#8 Jesse’s plan to look for money at Todd’s apartment was nothing short of a flashback!

indiewire.com

He starts off by stripping off the wallpaper because that's where Walt would hide his money in between the walls, remember? He then checks under the sink, because that’s where he hid his own meth in season 2.

#9 The paper-weight that Jesse was looking at had Todd and Lydia’s toy versions.

Netflix

Todd was obsessed with Lydia, remember?

#10 Do you know, Jesse tells Ed that he was 96 percent sure that he is in the right place?

Netflix

He just didn’t make that number. That’s the reference to purity level of meth he used to cook – 96 percent.
description: Six years later, you might have forgotten the little details that were showed in El Camino: A Breaking Bad movie. These little details that you might have missed answered a lot of questions that we all had in our minds for about six long years. For die hard fans, the film was full of references from the show.
